member.name: M:dimensionArrows.curvedArrows.Deactivate
member.summary: Clean up the screen and reset the subtype if the command exits

member.summary: Handles keyDown events specific to this class

member.name: M:dimensionArrows.curvedArrows.setArrowOffset(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the offset distance from an imaginary line between the two arrow points

member.name: M:dimensionArrows.curvedArrows.CreateContextMenu(ESRI.ArcGIS.Framework.IApplication)
member.summary: Create a context menu for this class
member.remarks: Uses constant values to fill in the list

member.name: T:dimensionArrows.curvedArrows
member.summary: Place a pair of curved dimension arrows for bearings and distances. Two clicks position the points of the arrows and a third click sets the offset from an imaginary line between the points. 0 to 4 dashes may be added to the ends of the arrows using the keyboard.

member.summary: Enumeration of ESRI mouse button constant values.

member.summary: Enumeration of arrow types.

member.name: T:dimensionArrows.arrowUtilities.arrowStyles
member.summary: Enumeration of single arrow styles

member.name: M:dimensionArrows.arrowUtilities.getDataFrameCoords(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts mouse screen coordinates to data frame coordinates

member.name: M:dimensionArrows.arrowUtilities.getSnapPoint(ESRI.ArcGIS.Geometry.IPoint)
member.summary: If snapping is on, finds the snap point
member.remarks: If there is no snap point the original point is returned

member.name: M:dimensionArrows.arrowUtilities.getScreenCoords(ESRI.ArcGIS.Geometry.IPoint)
member.summary: Converts a geographic to a screen point

member.name: M:dimensionArrows.arrowUtilities.setLineFeedback(ESRI.ArcGIS.Geometry.IPoint)
member.summary: Set up the arrow display after the first mouse click
member.param: Mouse position in data frame coordinates

member.name: M:dimensionArrows.arrowUtilities.placeArrows(ESRI.ArcGIS.Geometry.IPoint,ESRI.ArcGIS.Geometry.IPoint)
member.summary: Places the arrows after the last mouse click
member.param: Mouse position in data frame coordinates
Option second mouse point for arrows that require three points

member.name: M:dimensionArrows.arrowUtilities.perpendicularAngle
member.summary: Finds the angle perpendicular to the selected line for straight opposing arrows

member.name: M:dimensionArrows.arrowUtilities.SetScale(ESRI.ArcGIS.Geometry.IPoint)
member.summary: Finds the map scale based on the underlying MapIndex polygon and saves it in the _arrowScale variable
member.remarks: If there is no map index a scale of 1 (1"=100') is set

member.name: M:dimensionArrows.arrowUtilities.getArrowGeometry(ESRI.ArcGIS.Geometry.IPoint)
member.summary: Get the geometry of the paired arrows
member.param: Mouse position in data frame coordinates

member.summary: Save the current feature class and subtype

member.summary: Set the subtype of the arrows

member.name: M:dimensionArrows.arrowUtilities.resetSubtype
member.summary: Reset the feature class and subtype after placing the arrow

member.summary: Show the arrows while moving the mouse
member.param: Mouse position in data frame coordinates
Option second mouse point for arrows that require three points

member.summary: Get the geometry for a single arrow
member.param: Mouse position in data frame coordinates
Optional second mouse point for arrows that require three points
member.returns: The arrow geometry as an IPolyLine

member.summary: Finds the arrow subtype based on the current edit layer

member.summary: Draws the arrow image to the screen

member.summary: Places a freeform arrow when the user double-clicks or selects finish from the context menu

member.summary: Clears the graphics container

member.name: P:dimensionArrows.My.Resources.Resources.dimensionArrowGeometry
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?> <!--Arrow definitions for the dimensionArrows toolbar--> <arrowDef> <straight> <segments count="1"/> <segment points="0,0,20,0"/> </straight> <landHookFlipped> <segments count="2"/> <segment points="0,0,-20,0" /> <segment points="-20,0,-15,5" /> </landHookFlipped> <landHook> <segments count="2"/> <segment points="0,0,-20,0" /> <segment points="-20,0,-15,-5" /> </landHook> <curved0> <segments count="10" [rest of string was truncated]";.
